# Agent Context - ID8Labs LLC

Pre-loaded context for all 9 LLC-Ops agents. Reference this before every agent invocation.

---

## Quick Reference Card

```
OWNER: Eduardo Belaval (Eddie)
ENTITY: ID8Labs LLC (NOT YET FORMED)
STATE: Florida
STATUS: Pre-revenue, Planning Stage
PRIMARY INCOME: W-2 Job ($50-100K, 22% bracket)
FILING: Single
TAX STANCE: Aggressive (maximize legal deductions)
ADMIN STYLE: Delegate everything, minimal time
```

---

## SENTINEL Context

**Current Compliance Status:** Nothing to comply with yet - LLC not formed.

**When LLC Forms:**
- May 1, 2026: First annual report due ($138.75)
- Estimated taxes: Not required until LLC income + W-2 withholding gap
- 1099s: Not applicable (no contractors planned)

**Watch Items:**
- Formation date (triggers annual report calendar)
- First revenue (triggers estimated tax consideration)

---

**Current Expense Situation:**
- Pre-formation expenses exist (software, tools)
- Can be deducted as startup costs once LLC active

| AI/Dev | Claude, Cursor, GitHub | $50-200 |
| Hosting | Vercel, Supabase, domains | $20-100 |
| Design/Prod | Figma, Notion | $20-50 |

**Tracking System:** None - needs to be built

**Receipt Situation:** Unknown - needs audit

**Optimization Stance:** Aggressive - push deductions to limit

---

## FILER Context

**Immediate Filings Needed:**
1. Florida LLC Formation (sunbiz.org) - $125
2. EIN Application (irs.gov) - Free, instant after #1
3. Operating Agreement - Internal, no filing

**Formation Prerequisites:**
- Name availability check
- Registered agent (can be self if FL resident)
- Management structure decision (member-managed)

**Filing Preferences:**
- Walk-through style guidance
- Maximum automation
- Document everything

---

## ADVISOR Context

**Entity Structure Decisions:**
| Decision | Current Answer | Revisit When |
|----------|----------------|--------------|
| Entity Type | SMLLC | Never (appropriate) |
| Tax Classification | Disregarded | Profit > $50K/year |
| S-Corp Election | No | Profit > $50K/year consistently |

**Legal Concerns:**
- Operating agreement: Essential for liability protection
- Commingling: Must avoid, bank account priority
- IP ownership: All work should be in LLC name

**Professional Referral Threshold:**
- Complex multi-state issues
- Audit representation
- Litigation

---

## STRATEGIST Context

**Tax Optimization Opportunities:**

| Strategy | Status | Action |
|----------|--------|--------|
| Maximize Deductions | Open | Track everything |
| Home Office | Ready | Document, calculate |
| Equipment/Section 179 | Future | When purchases occur |
| Retirement (SEP/Solo 401k) | Future | When revenue exists |
| R&D Credit | Future | Software dev qualifies |
| S-Corp Election | Future | When profit > $50K |

**Current Tax Profile:**
- W-2: 22% bracket, SE tax on W-2 already handled
- LLC income: Will add 15.3% SE + 22-24% income tax
- QBI deduction: Should qualify (under threshold)

**Aggressive Optimization Preferences:**
- Owner wants maximum legal deductions
- Comfortable with gray areas
- Willing to document and defend

## MENTOR Context

**Owner Learning Profile:**
- **Level:** Some basics (not beginner, not expert)
- **Style:** Prefers automation over manual learning
- **Gaps:** Execution mechanics, gray area navigation
- **Motivation:** Aggressive optimization

**Teaching Priorities:**
1. What counts as deductible (and audit risk levels)
2. How to document for audit defense
3. Gray areas: where the line is
4. When to involve professionals

**Communication Style:**
- Direct, action-oriented
- Quantify everything ($X saves $Y)
- Risk/reward framing

## Pre-Invocation Checklist

Before ANY agent activation, verify:
- [ ] LLC formation status (update when formed)
- [ ] Revenue status (update when income starts)
- [ ] Any new expenses/assets acquired
- [ ] Approaching deadlines
